title: Hole - 1998-12-05, Fairfax VA - FM - Don't Get Mad Get Even
description:
Hole - 1998-12-05, Patriot Center, Fairfax VA - FM 

Fast Fest Set Bootleg Up! - Don't Get Mad Get Even


Don't Get Got Get Hot


This uncensored late-night Radio Virginia, 
holy quality high, 
hot shit sick show, 
let it shine 
its slut kiss girl on me.


Meanwhile back in the states, "Live Through This" has been out for twenty years now, and yet where is the major celebration, the retrospective rerelease, the live shows, demos and demons, the public bowing and scraping inside a hole-shaped box of memories and mammaries, dreams and screams of discovery of the mysteries of misery and mastery.


[Before 'Dying']

CL: "I learned a French phrase today, Melissa. Are you ready? 

'La vie c'est une battaile.' 

Do you know what that means? 'Life is a battle!'

(Really, we're gonna, OK, so.) On 3, let's do it again.

MADM: [softly] "1, 2, 3..."

ALL: [loudly] "Fuck!"

___________________________

GRUNGEPUNKPOPROCKTOBER 3


FEAST OF FREE SPIRITS.
VIRUS APPRECIATION DAY.
TAGGER'S DAY.


Text par mois pour vous bien sur.

"Someday you will ache like I ache."

And the kettle whistle is screaming right about now.


Meanwhile Courtney is presently a bit character on TV's 'Sons of Anarchy.' 


Then she is set to sing lead on stage in a soap pop opera, 'Kansas City Choir Boy,' for New YorkÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Prototype: Opera/Theater/Now Festival from Jan. 8 to 17.


But here Love is doing it like it used to be 
to the 9's in the 90's, in her own punk pop elle-ment 
there comes a wave of blue heaven 
delivering Hole's rolling soul through hell and all get out 
all to get pretty damn deep inside us.
